data.name: Btn_UseLegacyCredsDowngrade
data.value: Continue using KeePass Google Sync 3.0 credentials.

data.name: Btn_UseNewCredsUpgrade
data.value: Upgrade the plugin's Google Drive Authorization (Recommended).

data.name: Err_LoadConfigurationFailed
data.value: An error occurred loading the plug-in configuration.

data.name: Err_TokenInvalidClient
data.value: Either Client ID or Client Secret is invalid.

data.name: Err_TokenInvalidGrant
data.value: The provided authorization grant (e.g., authorization code, resource owner credentials) or refresh token is invalid, expired, revoked, does not match the redirection URI used in the authorization request, or was issued to another client.

data.name: Err_TokenInvalidReq
data.value: Either Client ID or Client Secret is missing.

data.name: Err_TokenInvalidScope
data.value: The requested scope is invalid, unknown, malformed, or exceeds the scope granted by the resource owner.

data.name: Err_TokenUnauthClient
data.value: The authenticated client is not authorized to use this authorization grant type.

data.name: Err_TokenUnsupportedGrant
data.value: The authorization grant type is not supported by the authorization server.

data.name: Exc_MultipleGDriveFilesFmt
data.value: The operation was cancelled because more than one file named '{0}' was found in the Target Folder. This can occur when files are copied or created by another program with limited authorization credentials. Resolve the conflict manually (e.g., examine Drive file modification times) and ensure only one file named '{0}' exists in the target Drive folder.

data.name: Exc_NoImportPermission
data.value:
Synchronization failed.
You do not have permission to import. Adjust your KeePass configuration.

data.name: Exc_SyncFailureOther
data.value:
Synchronization failed.
If the error was that master keys (passwords) do not match, use Upload / Download commands instead of Sync or change the local master key to match that of the remote database.

data.name: Html_AuthResponseString
data.value:
Google Sign-In Authorization Complete

Please return to KeePass.

data.name: Lbl_AutoSyncOnOpen
data.value: Sync before Opening a KeePass Database

data.name: Lbl_AutoSyncOnSave
data.value: Sync when Saving a KeePass Database

data.name: Lbl_DefaultTargetFolderHint
data.value: (Leave blank to use a single, uniquely named file across all folders.)

data.name: Lbl_LegacyAttribution
data.value: Based on KeePass Google Sync Plugin 3.0, Copyright © 2016 DesignsInnovate.

data.name: Lbl_UseLegacyClientID
data.value: Use KeePass Google Sync 3.0 App Credentials.

data.name: Msg_AppCredsUpgrade
data.value:
Upgrading eliminates problems with the old plugin's built-in OAuth 2.0 credentials, which have exceeded Google's limits for new authorizations. Using the new built-in credentials is recommended unless you have compelling reasons to use personal OAuth 2.0 credentials.
After upgrading, you will be required to re-authorize with Google Sign-in.
Click Cancel to decide later and abandon the current plugin operation.

data.name: Msg_AuthDialog
data.value:
The system Browser has been opened for you to sign in to your Google account (if necessary) and authorize the plugin to sync your KeePass database. The plugin cannot operate without your authorization. If the plugin entry includes your Google user name and password, you may access them via the buttons below.
This notification window closes automatically after authorization in the browser is complete. To return to KeePass without authorizing the plugin, click Cancel.

data.name: Msg_AutoSyncIgnore
data.value: Shift Key pressed. Auto Sync ignored.

data.name: Msg_ChangedCredsDeletesToken
data.value: You have changed settings that effect the Drive authorization token saved in the database. Proceeding will delete the token and you may be required to Sign-in the next time the plugin accesses Drive. Click OK to confirm.

data.name: Msg_DownloadFileFmt
data.value: Getting a copy of '{0}' file from Drive...

data.name: Msg_FileUpdatedFmt
data.value: File on Google Drive updated. Name: {0}, ID: {1}

data.name: Msg_FileUploadedFmt
data.value: File uploaded to Google Drive. Name: {0}, ID: {1}

data.name: Msg_FirstOpenDb
data.value: You first need to open a database.

data.name: Msg_GDriveFileNotFound
data.value: File name not found on Google Drive. Please upload or sync with Google Drive first.

data.name: Msg_LocalDbOnly
data.value: Only databases stored locally or on a network share are supported. Save your database locally or on a network share and try again.

data.name: Msg_NewEntryNotesFmt
data.value: This entry was generated by {0}. Consider adding your Google user and password to this entry. This will allow you to access them if you ever need to authorize the plugin again.

data.name: Msg_NoAcct
data.value:
No Plugin Configuration Entry Found
The plugin requires a KeePass entry to store Google Drive authorization data. It is convenient if this entry also contains your Google Sign-in user/password. To create an entry without credentials (you can add them later), click Yes.
Otherwise, return to KeePass to create a new entry or edit an existing one, ensuring that the entry's URL field contains the string '{0}'.

data.name: Msg_NoActiveAccount
data.value:
Plugin-Compatible Entries Found
One or more entries in this database can store the plugin's configuration data. Click OK to open the Configuration dialog, allowing selection and configuration of an active plugin entry.
Otherwise click Cancel to abandon this operation.
In either case, you can select another entry later to be the active plugin entry, with the Configuration command on the plugin menu.

data.name: Msg_NoAutoSyncConfig
data.value: No valid configuration found. Auto Sync ignored.

data.name: Msg_OauthCredsInvalidFmt
data.value: Please enter a valid custom OAuth 2.0 Client ID and Client Secrect for {0} or select Legacy Client ID.

data.name: Msg_PasswdUuidEntryMissingFmt
data.value: Password entry with UUID '{0}' not found.

data.name: Msg_ReplaceDbFailedFmt
data.value: Replacing current database failed. File downloaded as '{0}'.

data.name: Msg_ReplaceDbStatusFmt
data.value: Database '{0}' replaced by copy of Google Drive File.

data.name: Msg_ReplacingFile
data.value: Replacing local copy of file with downloaded file...

data.name: Msg_SaveUserAuth
data.value: Adding user authorization token to the database...

data.name: Msg_Synchronizing
data.value: Synchronizing current database with Drive copy...

data.name: Msg_UploadingSync
data.value: Uploading copy of synchronized database to Drive...

data.name: Msg_UserAuth
data.value: User must authorize Google Drive access.

data.name: Msg_UuidEntryInvalid
data.value: The entered UUID is not valid.

data.name: Title_AuthDialogSub
data.value: Please Do Not Close This Window

data.name: Lnk_HelpAppCredsPrivacy
data.value: KPSync for Google Drive privacy policy.

data.name: Exc_MultipleGDriveFilesFmt_NoFolder
data.value: More than one file or shortcut named '{0}' found on Google Drive. Please make sure the name is unique across all folders, or use the Target Folder feature.

data.name: Exc_MultipleFilesAndFolderFmt
data.value: More than on folder named '{1}' was found on Google Drive, and multiple files and/or shortcuts named '{0}' are contained by them. Please make sure the name is unique across all folders specified by Target Folder.

data.name: Exc_MultipleFoldersFmt
data.value: More than on folder named '{1}' was found on Google Drive. The Target Folder must be unique, either my name or by exclusively containing a file named '{0}'.

data.name: Exc_ShortcutNoLink
data.value: Invalid Drive Shortcut. A shortcut named '{0}' was found, but it is not linked to an accessible file.

data.name: Exc_ShortcutTargetIdMissing
data.value: Invalid Drive Shortcut. A shortcut named '{0}' was found, but it does not contain a linked file ID.

data.name: Exc_ShortcutTargetTrashed
data.value: The Drive shortcut '{1}' links to file '{0}' in the Trash. To sync with '{0}', move it out of the Trash folder.

data.name: SubTitle_SharedFileError
data.value: {0} is shared with other Drive accounts.

data.name: Msg_SharedFileError
data.value:
For plugin security, the current settings prohibit sync operations on this file.
To safely sync this file, you need to enable session authorization tokens (Drive Authorization Token Handling) in the Sync Authorization tab of the settings dialog.
Alternatively, you can configure the plugin to use personal OAuth 2.0 application credentials.

data.name: Exc_SharedFile
data.value: Sync operations with files shared with other Drive accounts are not configured.

data.name: Msg_SavingConfig
data.value: Saving configuration changes to the database...

data.name: Msg_SavingSharedFileChoice
data.value: Saving your choice in the database entry...

data.name: Lbl_DontSaveAuthToken
data.value: Do not save Google Drive authorization in the database.

data.name: Lnk_AuthTokenHelp
data.value: Why should this be enabled for shared databases?

data.name: Lbl_DontSaveAuthDefault
data.value: Do not save authorization tokens in new databases.

data.name: Lbl_WarnEntryAuthToken
data.value: Warn me before using a stored authorization token.

data.name: Lnk_AuthTokenAppHelp
data.value: Why should I do this if I use shared databases?

data.name: Msg_AuthTokenPrompting
data.value: Auth token found: query user to proceed.

data.name: Msg_SavedAuthWarning
data.value:
This database contains a saved authorization token for Drive access.
Click OK to use this token to access Drive. Click Cancel to remove the token and re-authorize this KeePass session with Google Sign-On.
This warning is shown when database-stored authorization tokens are found. To avoid the warning, configure session-stored authorization tokens for this database.

data.name: Lbl_DontShowSavedAuthWarning
data.value: Disable warning and always use database-stored authorization tokens if possible.

data.name: Exc_DbClosedOnAutoSync
data.value: An auto-sync operation failed because the database was closed. This could be caused by another plugin or a composite KP operation. Retry the operation manually when the database is opened.

data.name: Msg_DeferredAutoSyncFmt
data.value:
Database {0} did not Auto Sync the last time changes were saved, because the KeePass {1} operation which saved the changes also closed the database.
The local database could be out of sync with the Drive file. Would you like to sync the database now?

data.name: Lbl_AutoSyncOnReopen
data.value: Resume on return from Auto-Lock or Exit

data.name: AuthorizeFiles_tooltip
data.value: This plugin uses the restricted Drive.Files google scope. As such, it can only access files not created by itself if you explicitly give it access to those files, otherwise the plugin creates duplicate files at the target location
